qas.question: What terrorism-related resolution did the UN Security Council adopt in 2005?
Which countries haven't submitted the required reports to the UN Security Council?
What plan did the DoD release in 2005?

answers.text: National Military Strategic Plan for the War on Terrorism

qas.question: What did Resolution 1624 try to protect?
What year did Israel adopt Resolution 1964?
What did the UN Security Council decline to offer reports for?

plausible_answers.text: National Military Strategic Plan for the War on Terrorism

qas.question: What document did the Israeli Department of Defense publish?
Which two countries submitted annual reports?

context: In <b4_0>2005<b4_0/>, the UN Security Council adopted <a0_0><b5_0>Resolution 1624<b5_0/><a0_0/> concerning incitement to commit acts of terrorism and the obligations of countries to comply with <a3_0>international human rights laws<a3_0/>. Although both resolutions require mandatory annual reports on counter-terrorism activities by adopting nations, <a1_0>the <b7_0>United States and Israel<b7_0/><a1_0/> have both declined to submit reports. In the same year, the United States <b8_0>Department of Defense<b8_0/> and the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff issued a planning document, by the name "<a2_0><b6_0>National Military Strategic Plan for the War on Terrorism<b6_0/><a2_0/>", which stated that it constituted the "comprehensive military plan to prosecute the Global War on Terror for the Armed Forces of the United States...including the findings and recommendations of the 9/11 Commission and a rigorous examination with the Department of Defense".
